New Records: San Diego Padres hit a franchise playoff record six home runs, tying an MLB playoff record
Yu Darvish pitched a strong game with seven one-run innings
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. hit two home runs
Jackson Merrill made a defensive highlight play
Jurickson Profar robbed Mookie Betts of a home run
Fans caused a 12-minute delay by throwing objects onto the field
Jack Flaherty and Manny Machado exchanged heated words
Freddie Freeman exited the game due to an ankle injury
Pre-Game Insights: The series was tied 1-1 after the second game
The Padres and Dodgers were preparing for the next game in the series
Post-Match Reflections: Manny Machado called a team meeting after the delay
Freddie Freeman's injury status was a concern
Mookie Betts struggled with a poor performance in the postseason
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had a lot of home runs, setting a franchise record for the Padres
There was a delay due to fans throwing objects
Shohei Ohtani went 0 for 4 with two strikeouts
Others: The Padres' victory came after a day of squandering multi-run leads
The game was played at Dodger Stadium
